message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL

The paper deals with quantitative approaches to evaluating research interests and expertise, which are relevant to several sub-fields of computer science. Specifically, the use of barycenters and similarity-adapted publication vectors suggests a focus on information retrieval (cs.IR), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), machine learning (cs.LG), social networks (cs.SI), and computational linguistics (cs.CL).
